intro:
Is developing a paranoid protocol for anonymous wireless communications, [aDTN](../18USGqZSWppp9zdvwsD1oauq2UMuA3CFUC)

Likes decentralization, anonymity, wireless/mesh networks, FOSS, unconditional basic income and goats

Practices Aikido, is learning Japanese, and enjoys drawing/painting

post.body: Presenting my anonymous communication protocol for wireless networks, [aDTN](../18USGqZSWppp9zdvwsD1oauq2UMuA3CFUC)
I just tried to edit and then delete a comment but it didn't work O_o

Just finished writing the [introduction/motivation of aDTN](../18USGqZSWppp9zdvwsD1oauq2UMuA3CFUC/?Page:introduction-to-adtn).

Next comes the "How does it work?" page, but I will only continue tomorrow. I've been writing all afternoon.

If you read it, please let me know if it's easy to understand and what could be improved (or if you find some error, you can fix it directly).

In other news...

[GO. WATCH. THE. EPIC. METEOR. SHOWER. TONIGHT.](http://www.popularmechanics.com/space/a22200/meteor-shower-of-the-decade/)

Added a TL;DR to the [aDTN introduction page](../18USGqZSWppp9zdvwsD1oauq2UMuA3CFUC/?Page:introduction-to-adtn).

Thanks for the feedback so far!
Bahh, I am so busy with work, I won't have time to add content to the aDTN wiki in the next days. Sorry :(
Going to present ZeroNet at my hackerspace tonight. I have been looking into the source code and all, just to be able to explain it properly :-)
Working a bit on the aDTN android app. I am starting it from scratch, but I am using Kotlin this time...

New [aDTN blog post](../1GToPFo7Q8JWuEvnUzWqdp83qKV8DNVcoE/), with a rant on Android programming:

> The developers are used to hammers, but the problem they need to solve is now a screw, so the Android project gave them a complicated contraption that attaches to the hammer and makes the screw turn when it gets hit.
Attending a talk on decentralization of communications at MRMCD'16: https://2016.mrmcd.net/fahrplan/events/7655.html
I am evangelizing students about ZeroNet :D

Today I have met a fellow student who is interested in helping me develop the Android app implementing the [aDTN](../18USGqZSWppp9zdvwsD1oauq2UMuA3CFUC/) protocol for anonymous device-to-device communication!! <3

I was at this year's edition of [Freedom Not Fear](https://www.freedomnotfear.org/) in Brussels. It was a lovely 2.5 day workshop, followed by a day at the European Parliament, and we worked hard to protect digital users' rights.

We hope to have convinced the politicians that personal data should not be included in trade agreements, as it should not be handled as merchandise.

We also discussed several rights issues in individual countries and found them to be incompatible with EU law, so we can now return home with better and stronger arguments.

We handled so many topics, ranging from very legalese things like personal data collection and retention laws and copyright to practical actions like campaigns to get journalists to use cryptotools. Did you know that in journalism schools in Denmark it's now mandatory to attend a course on cryptotools?

I had a really inspiring time there, and returning home was actually a bit heartbreaking. It's good to know I have secured a ticket to attend the [33C3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chaos_Communication_Congress) and will be seeing many of those great activists again.

comment.body: I like it like this, but I would like to have that as an option too.
I confirmed in the pop on the upper right corner that I want to delete it, then it shows the notification that the content was published to 5 users, but I still see it under the post.
I think it's an artistic way to write "0ME".
Ok. Thanks for reporting! :)

Thanks Alek! I am still not finished writing it, though :)

If I stop playing with ZeroMe I should be able to finish the rest of the basics in 1-2 days.
Yay!!! You are our hero, nofish! <3
Same here, I had to postpone it to tomorrow (forecast says no clouds). Too bad, since the peak is today. But tomorrow the meteors should still be visible enough.
Hi truth, there is now a summary of the features on the main wiki page, but I can add one on that page as well.
Alek, indeed, the Python library is more for my testbed experiments on throughput and security. I really do not like programming for Android so the app is really needing some love :(

@ks: there is one, I maintain it at the moment, but it was programmed by a group of students for a university project. It is quite buggy and only works on some phones, because they really tried to use wifi in ad-hoc mode, which is broken beyond repair. There is the possibility to switch to Bluetooth, but I do not have time to do it now.
Also, there is a page on the android app: http://127.0.0.1:43110/18USGqZSWppp9zdvwsD1oauq2UMuA3CFUC/?Page:android-messaging-app
np :)
Welcome to the party!! \o\

Hi Astzor, you just have to use markdown, like this: [link text](link url) 

Markdown is (still) not working in comments, though.

For preventing broken links when using proxies, I am using relative links, e.g.: ../SomeZeroAddress

Compartmentalization means that you isolate parts of your data and applications from each other.

One possible solution is to run untrusted applications on a virtual machine. Or keep the data you want secured on an air gapped machine: one that you never connect to a network, and then use an external disk to transfer data around (after doing some paranoid verification that it is clean of potential threats). 

It all depends on who you expect to try to steal/modify/destroy your data and what capabilities they have.
Also, what Zerro said about QubesOS... +1
@Tkarita: why do you say webtorrent is incompatible?
Oh, I promised I wouldn't use any slides. I think explaining how the system works while showing the real system is far more fun. But thanks anyway!
